required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Irritation and Sensitization Study of d-Amphetamine Transdermal System
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Evaluator-blinded Study to Evaluate Skin Irritation and Sensitization of d-Amphetamine Transdermal System in Healthy Adults

brief_summary.textblock: The study will assess skin irritation as well as sensitization for d-ATS patch in healthy subjects.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a randomized, evaluator-blinded study consisting of one (1) group. The study will assess skin irritation as well as sensitization for d-ATS patch in healthy subjects. All three (3) articles (d-ATS patch, placebo patch, and saline patch) will be applied simultaneously on the back of each subject. Healthy subjects will be enrolled to participate in two (2) phases: A Screening Phase and a Treatment Phase. The total duration of the study for each subject will be about 10 - 16 weeks. The Re-challenge Test will only be performed for subjects who experience any type of sensitization during Challenge Period.

primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with sensitization potential after repeated exposure to d-ATS, placebo and saline patches in healthy adults
Number of participants with skin irritation potential after repeated exposure to d-ATS, placebo and saline patches in healthy adults

arm_group.description: dATS, placebo and saline will be administered simultaneously
